questions.question: If <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>29</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Subtract 5 from both sides: <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>24</mn></math>. Divide both sides by 4: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Isolate the variable by performing inverse operations in the reverse order of how they were applied.

questions.question: A jar contains 12 red marbles, 8 blue marbles, and 10 green marbles. If one marble is chosen at random, what is the probability that it is blue?
questions.explanation: Total marbles = <math><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math>. Number of blue marbles = 8. Probability = <math><mfrac><mn>8</mn><mn>30</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>15</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Probability = (Favorable Outcomes) / (Total Possible Outcomes). Always simplify the fraction.

questions.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup></math>?
questions.explanation: When multiplying terms with the same base, add the exponents: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>8</mn></msup></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember exponent rules: <math><msup><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi></msup><mo>·</mo><msup><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>a</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></math>.

questions.question: A shirt originally priced at $40 is on sale for 25% off. What is the sale price?
questions.explanation: Discount = 25% of $40 = <math><mn>0.25</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> dollars. Sale price = <math><mn>40</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math> dollars.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find a percentage of a number, convert the percentage to a decimal and multiply.

questions.question_chart_description: Note: Figure not drawn to scale.
questions.question: In triangle ABC, the measure of angle A is <math><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo></math> and the measure of angle B is <math><mn>70</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of angle C?
questions.explanation: The sum of angles in a triangle is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. So, angle C = <math><mn>180</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember the Triangle Sum Theorem: the interior angles of a triangle always add up to 180 degrees.

questions.question: What are the solutions to the equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Factor the quadratic: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. So <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a quadratic equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, look for two numbers that multiply to <math><mi>c</mi></math> and add to <math><mi>b</mi></math>.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question:
What is the solution (x,y) to the system of equations?
x+y=7
x-y=3
questions.explanation: Add the two equations to eliminate y: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> → <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> → <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Substitute into the first equation: <math><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For systems, consider elimination by adding or subtracting equations to cancel one variable.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: A car travels 240 miles on 8 gallons of gasoline. At the same rate, how many miles can it travel on 15 gallons of gasoline?
questions.explanation: Miles per gallon = <math><mfrac><mn>240</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math> miles/gallon. For 15 gallons: <math><mn>30</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>450</mn></math> miles.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Find the unit rate (miles per gallon) first, then multiply by the new quantity.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='200' viewBox='0 0 300 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='200' fill='white'/><polygon points='50,150 230,150 230,75' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><polyline points='220,150 220,140 230,140' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='40' y='165' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='235' y='165' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='225' y='65' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>C</text><text x='140' y='170' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>12</text><text x='245' y='120' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><text x='130' y='100' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle' font-weight='bold'>?</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle ABC, where angle B is 90 degrees. Side BC (vertical) is length 5. Side AB (horizontal) is length 12. Find side AC (hypotenuse).
questions.question: In right triangle ABC shown, <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> and <math><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. What is the length of <math><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Use the Pythagorean Theorem: <math><msup><mi>AC</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>AB</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>BC</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. So <math><mi>AC</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mn>12</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>144</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>169</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>13</mn></math>.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='200' viewBox='0 0 300 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='200' fill='white'/><polygon points='50,150 230,150 230,75' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><polyline points='220,150 220,140 230,140' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='50' y1='150' x2='230' y2='75' stroke='red' stroke-width='3' /><text x='40' y='165' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='235' y='165' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='225' y='65' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>C</text><text x='140' y='170' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>12</text><text x='245' y='120' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><text x='130' y='100' font-family='Arial' font-size='16' text-anchor='middle' fill='red' font-weight='bold'>13</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Right triangle with sides 12 and 5 labeled. Hypotenuse AC is calculated as 13 and shown in red.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For right triangles, the Pythagorean Theorem (<math><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>) is your go-to tool for finding side lengths.

questions.question: A bag contains 3 red, 4 blue, and 5 green marbles. Two marbles are drawn without replacement. What is the probability that the first marble is red and the second marble is blue?
questions.explanation: Probability first is red = <math><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac></math>. After removing one red, total marbles = 11, blue marbles remain 4. Probability second is blue = <math><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>11</mn></mfrac></math>. Combined probability = <math><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>11</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>12</mn><mn>132</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>11</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For 'without replacement' probability, adjust the denominator after each draw.

questions.question: For what value of <math><mi>k</mi></math> does the equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> have exactly one real solution?
questions.explanation: A quadratic has exactly one real solution when its discriminant is zero. Discriminant <math><mi>D</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>k</mi></math>. Set <math><mi>D</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>: <math><mn>36</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><mn>4</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math> → <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The discriminant (<math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></math>) determines the nature of roots. One real solution means discriminant = 0.

questions.question: A box contains 2 red balls and 3 blue balls. Balls are drawn one at a time without replacement until a red ball is drawn. What is the probability that the red ball is drawn on the third draw?
questions.explanation: Red is drawn on the 3rd draw means the first two draws are blue. P(first is blue) = <math><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>. P(second is blue | first was blue) = <math><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. P(third is red | first two blue) = <math><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> (2 reds remain of 3 total). Multiply: <math><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mn>30</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For sequential 'without replacement' problems, multiply the probabilities of each step, updating the counts after each draw.

questions.question: Which of the following represents all values of <math><mi>x</mi></math> that satisfy the inequality <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Subtract 2x from both sides: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>></mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Subtract 2 from both sides: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>></mo><mi>x</mi></math>, which is equivalent to <math><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving inequalities, remember to flip the inequality sign if you multiply or divide by a negative number.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><g stroke='#f0f0f0' stroke-width='1'><line x1='0' y1='250' x2='400' y2='250' /><line x1='0' y1='190' x2='400' y2='190' /><line x1='0' y1='130' x2='400' y2='130' /><line x1='0' y1='70' x2='400' y2='70' /><line x1='200' y1='0' x2='200' y2='300' /><line x1='260' y1='0' x2='260' y2='300' /><line x1='140' y1='0' x2='140' y2='300' /></g><line x1='20' y1='250' x2='380' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='200' y1='280' x2='200' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='370' y='240' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='210' y='30' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>f(x)</text><text x='190' y='265' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>0</text><path d='M 80 10 Q 140 130 200 190 T 380 242' fill='none' stroke='blue' stroke-width='3' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A graph on the coordinate plane showing a curve that is high in the second quadrant and decreases rapidly as it crosses the y-axis at a positive value, approaching the x-axis as an asymptote in the first quadrant.
questions.question: The graph of an exponential function <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is shown. Which of the following could be the equation of <math><mi>f</mi></math>?
questions.explanation:
The graph displays exponential decay, as the function values decrease as <math><mi>x</mi></math> increases. This characteristic occurs when the base of the exponential function is between 0 and 1. 

Check the options:
A) Base 2 (>1): Growth.
B) Base 1/2 (0 < b < 1): Decay.
C) Negative coefficient: Graph would be below the x-axis.
D) Negative coefficient: Graph would be below the x-axis.

Only option B represents a positive decay function matching the graph.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='20' y1='250' x2='380' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='200' y1='280' x2='200' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><path d='M 80 10 Q 140 130 200 190 T 380 242' fill='none' stroke='blue' stroke-width='3' opacity='0.5' /><circle cx='200' cy='190' r='5' fill='red' /><text x='210' y='185' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' fill='red' font-weight='bold'>(0, 1)</text><line x1='100' y1='60' x2='160' y2='140' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='170' y='120' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' fill='red' font-weight='bold'>Decreasing (Decay)</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Exponential decay curve with base between 0 and 1.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For exponential functions, if the base > 1, the graph shows growth; if 0 < base < 1, it shows decay.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><g stroke='#f0f0f0' stroke-width='1'><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' /><line x1='50' y1='200' x2='350' y2='200' /><line x1='50' y1='150' x2='350' y2='150' /><line x1='50' y1='100' x2='350' y2='100' /><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='350' y2='50' /></g><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='340' y='240' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>x</text><text x='60' y='40' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>y</text><g fill='black'><circle cx='80' cy='60' r='3'/><circle cx='100' cy='75' r='3'/><circle cx='120' cy='100' r='3'/><circle cx='140' cy='115' r='3'/><circle cx='160' cy='140' r='3'/><circle cx='180' cy='155' r='3'/><circle cx='200' cy='180' r='3'/><circle cx='220' cy='195' r='3'/><circle cx='240' cy='220' r='3'/></g></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A scatterplot with 9 points forming a pattern that slopes downward from left to right (negative linear association).
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y. Which of the following best describes the correlation?
questions.explanation: The points clearly show a downward trend from left to right. They are clustered closely around an imaginary line, indicating a strong linear relationship. A downward trend indicates a negative correlation.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='70' y1='50' x2='250' y2='230' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><g fill='black' opacity='0.3'><circle cx='80' cy='60' r='3'/><circle cx='100' cy='75' r='3'/><circle cx='120' cy='100' r='3'/><circle cx='140' cy='115' r='3'/><circle cx='160' cy='140' r='3'/><circle cx='180' cy='155' r='3'/><circle cx='200' cy='180' r='3'/><circle cx='220' cy='195' r='3'/><circle cx='240' cy='220' r='3'/></g><text x='180' y='60' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' fill='red' font-weight='bold'>Negative Slope</text><path d='M 180 70 L 220 100' stroke='red' stroke-width='1' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Scatterplot with a dashed red line showing a strong negative linear trend.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Correlation strength is judged by how closely points cluster around a line. Direction is positive if the line slopes upward, negative if downward.

questions.question: The line with equation <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math> passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>m</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute the coordinates of the point into the equation: <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Solve for <math><mi>m</mi></math>: <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math> → <math><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></math> → <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: A point lies on a line if its coordinates satisfy the line's equation. Use this to find missing constants.

questions.question: A rectangular box has dimensions 5 cm by 8 cm by 10 cm. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of the box?
questions.explanation: Volume of a rectangular prism = length × width × height = <math><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn></math> cubic cm.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For rectangular prisms, remember the volume formula: V = lwh.

questions.question: If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is a solution to the system <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Set the equations equal: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Subtract <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> from both sides: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. So <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Since <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the solution is <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To solve a system of equations where one is nonlinear, set the expressions for y equal to each other and solve for x.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white'/><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='100' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='150' x2='250' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='140' y='145' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>O</text><text x='200' y='140' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>10</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A circle with center O and radius 10. A radius is drawn from the center to a point on the circle. The length of the radius is labeled as 10.
questions.question: A circle has center O and radius 10. What is the circumference of the circle?
questions.explanation: Circumference of a circle = <math><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi></math>. Given radius <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>, circumference = <math><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>π</mi></math>.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white'/><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='100' fill='none' stroke='red' stroke-width='3'/><line x1='150' y1='150' x2='250' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='140' y='145' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>O</text><text x='200' y='140' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>r = 10</text><text x='150' y='275' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle' fill='red' font-weight='bold'>C = 2π(10) = 20π</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Circle with radius labeled as 10. The circumference formula and result are displayed.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Key circle formulas: Circumference = <math><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi></math>; Area = <math><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

questions.question: In a class of 30 students, 18 are taking math and 12 are taking science. If 8 students are taking both subjects, what is the probability that a randomly selected student is taking math but not science?
questions.explanation: Number of students taking math only = (Total taking math) - (Taking both) = <math><mn>18</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Total students = 30. Probability = <math><mfrac><mn>10</mn><mn>30</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use a Venn diagram or the formula: Only A = Total in A - (Both A and B).
